intro: Cacalia kleinia, commonly known as the dwarf bluebell, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has slender, hairy stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Cacalia kleinia is often cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance and ability to attract pollinators.
